thread.title: Broker TD Ameritrade suffers system-wide outage

title: Broker TD Ameritrade suffers system-wide outage
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Broker TD Ameritrade back up after suffering apparent outage for some clients The company "encountered an issue in which clients using our trading website were unable to see balance and position information. The ability to trade was not impacted," a company spokeswoman says. Post to Facebook Broker TD Ameritrade back up after suffering apparent outage for some clients The company "encountered an issue in which clients using our trading website were unable to see balance and position information. The ability to trade was not impacted," a company spokeswoman says. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: https://usat.ly/2G7owx8 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Broker TD Ameritrade back up after suffering apparent outage for some clients Fred Imbert, CNBC Published 10:05 a.m. ET March 26, 2018 | Updated 1:14 p.m. ET March 26, 2018 CLOSE Stocks around the world plunged Friday as investors feared that a trade conflict between the U.S. and China, the biggest economies in the world, would escalate. A second day of big losses pushed U.S. stocks to their worst week in two years. (Mar. 23) AP TD Ameritrade's Headquarters at night. (Photo: TD Ameritrade) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE Some clients of online broker TD Ameritrade suffered an apparent outage that prevented them from fully accessing their accounts Monday morning. News about the technical issues emerged about an hour before U.S. stocks opened for trading. Both of my accounts are inaccessible this morning@TDAmeritrade — Michael Maggard (@MichaelMaggar20) March 26, 2018 Hey @TDAmeritrade , 20 mins til market opens and your site is down. Not a good look. — Aram Tolegian (@ChemicalAT) March 26, 2018 @TDAmeritrade any outage reported on your website? Can't load my account... though I am logged in.... #needhelp — Philippe P (@philoutweet4u) March 26, 2018 A TD Ameritrade spokeswoman told CNBC the company "encountered an issue in which clients using our trading website were unable to see balance and position information. The ability to trade was not impacted." The company also said via its Twitter account that it had not been hacked, noting clients could still access their accounts through TD's Thinkorswim platform or the Mobile Trader application. For now please use Thinkorswim or the Mobile Trader app to access your account. You can also give us a call (there are long hold times due to the issue) and we can place your trades. We are very sorry for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience. ^TH — TD Ameritrade (@TDAmeritrade) March 26, 2018 The company's stock traded 2.5 percent higher on Monday afternoon. © CNBC is a USA TODAY content partner offering financial news and commentary. Its content is produced independently of USA TODAY. CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE
